```{r}
library(altair)
library(dplyr)
```

On utilise un jeu de donnees du package altair :
```{r}
vega_data <- import_vega_data()

data <- vega_data$cars() %>% filter(Miles_per_Gallon > 0)

```

On r√©alise le graphique :
```{r}
alt$Chart(data)$
  transform_bin(
    c('binned'),
    field='Miles_per_Gallon',
    bin=alt$Bin(maxbins=20))$
  transform_aggregate(
    value_count='count()',
    groupby=c('Origin', 'binned'))$
  mark_area(interpolate='monotone', orient='horizontal')$
  encode(
    x=alt$X(
      'value_count:Q',
      title=NULL,
      stack='center',
      axis=alt$Axis(
        labels=F,
        grid=F,
        ticks=T)),
    y=alt$Y(
      'binned:Q',
      bin='binned',
      title='Miles per Gallon'),
    color=alt$Color(
      'Origin:N',
      legend=NULL),
    column=alt$Column(
        'Origin:N',
        header=alt$Header(
            titleOrient='bottom',
            labelOrient='bottom',
            labelPadding=0)))$
  properties(
    width=80)$
  configure_facet(
    spacing=0)$
  configure_view(
    stroke=NULL)
```
